question: Which of the following statements expresses a relationship between aging and sexual functioning
choice0: Aging is related to an increase in vaginal lubrication
choice1: Aging is associated with an increase in the frequency and number of orgasmic contractions in both sexes
choice2: There is no significant relationship between aging and sexual responses in either sex
choice3: Aging is related to some loss of erectile rigidity in the male
completion:
The following are multiple choice questions (with answers) about  professional psychology.

One of your therapy clients asks your advice about a good weight- reduction program. You have investigated the programs in the community and are enrolled in the one you consider the best. This program offers a $50 bonus to its patrons for each new person they bring into the program. Under these circumstances, your most appropriate response would be to
A. tell your client the pros and cons of each program you know about except for the one in which you are enrolled
B. recommend to your client the program in which you are enrolled and explain the $50 bonus you will receive
C. recommend to your client the program in which you are enrolled and offer to have the $50 bonus credited to your client's account in the program
D. tell your client the pros and cons of each program you know about, but do not claim the $50 bonus if your client enrolls in your program
Answer: D

There are three ways to measure the Central Tendency: the Mean, the Median and the Mode. From your knowledge about them, what is the mode?
A. less sensitive to extreme scores than the mean
B. more useful for skewed distributions
C. sensitive to extreme values and highly skewed distributions
D. the most frequently occurring number
Answer: D

In terms of Hofstede’s (1980) five cultural dimensions, the United States scores at the top of the scale on:
A. individualism.
B. individualism and power distance.
C. power distance and masculinity.
D. uncertainty avoidance.
Answer: A

Carl Jung believed that a client's transference:
A. is a fantasy that distracts the client from reality.
B. represents “mixed feelings” toward the therapist. 
C. "is a form of ""acting out."""
D. reflects the client’s personal and collective unconscious.
Answer: D

In the construction of a multiple regression equation for purposes of prediction, the optimal combination of measures is one in which the predictors
A. are uncorrelated with each other but are moderately correlated with the criterion
B. have low correlations with each other and low correlations with the criterion
C. are highly intercorrelated with each other and moderately correlated with the criterion
D. have low correlations with the criterion bur are moderately correlated with each other
Answer: A

Which of the following statements expresses a relationship between aging and sexual functioning
A. Aging is related to an increase in vaginal lubrication
B. Aging is associated with an increase in the frequency and number of orgasmic contractions in both sexes
C. There is no significant relationship between aging and sexual responses in either sex
D. Aging is related to some loss of erectile rigidity in the male
Answer: D

question: One Friday afternoon, just before leaving on a weekend tip, a psychologist receives a call from a therapy client who claims to have taken an overdose of pills in a suicide attempt. The psychologist: tells the client to call a physician immediately and to come in at 9:00 A.M. on Monday for a session. The psychologist makes no other attempt to intervene, and the client dies later that evening without making any other calls for assistance. In this situation, the psychologist's behavior was clearly
choice0: unethical, because the client's needs were not addressed more directly
choice1: unethical, because the psychologist should have delayed the trip and given the client an appointment for that afternoon
choice2: unethical, because the psychologist should have called a physician directly
choice3: ethical, because it was not possible to determine whether or not the client was being manipulative

Dr. Jones, a clinical psychologist, has been seeing Lisa L. in therapy for one month. Dr. Jones considers Lisa to be a very attractive woman and finds himself having sexual fantasies about her. As an ethical psychologist, Dr. Jones should:
A. recognize that such attraction is normal but proceed with caution.
B. confess his attraction to Lisa and make it a topic for mutual examination in therapy.
C. recognize that such attraction is inappropriate and refer Lisa to another therapist without explaining the reason to her.
D. continue working with Lisa but consult with a colleague if he believes his attraction might be interfering with his objectivity.
Answer: D

One of your therapy clients asks your advice about a good weight- reduction program. You have investigated the programs in the community and are enrolled in the one you consider the best. This program offers a $50 bonus to its patrons for each new person they bring into the program. Under these circumstances, your most appropriate response would be to
A. tell your client the pros and cons of each program you know about except for the one in which you are enrolled
B. recommend to your client the program in which you are enrolled and explain the $50 bonus you will receive

D. tell your client the pros and cons of each program you know about, but do not claim the $50 bonus if your client enrolls in your program
Answer: D

A parent in family A delays for a long time before responding to a crying infant. In family B, a crying infant receives immediate attention. At night, a crying infant receives no attention in either family. According to traditional leaning theories, it would be anticipated that
A. for each infant, the length of nighttime crying will depend on the level of arousal
B. family A’s infant will cry for longer periods of time at night
C. family B’s infant will cry for longer periods of time at night
D. neither infant will tend to cry more than the other at any time
Answer: C

choice1: Self-perception theory predicts that participants in the $1.00 condition will subsequently report greater liking for the dull experiment, while cognitive dissonance theory predicts that participants in the $20.00 condition will subsequently report greater liking for the dull experiment.

choice3: Cognitive dissonance theory and self-perception theory both predict that participants in the $20.00 condition will subsequently report greater liking for the dull experiment than will those in the $1.00 condition.

One of your therapy clients asks your advice about a good weight- reduction program. You have investigated the programs in the community and are enrolled in the one you consider the best. This program offers a $50 bonus to its patrons for each new person they bring into the program. Under these circumstances, your most appropriate response would be to
A. tell your client the pros and cons of each program you know about except for the one in which you are enrolled
B. recommend to your client the program in which you are enrolled and explain the $50 bonus you will receive
C. recommend to your client the program in which you are enrolled and offer to have the $50 bonus credited to your client's account in the program
D. tell your client the pros and cons of each program you know about, but do not claim the $50 bonus if your client enrolls in your program
Answer: D

There are three ways to measure the Central Tendency: the Mean, the Median and the Mode. From your knowledge about them, what is the mode?
A. less sensitive to extreme scores than the mean
B. more useful for skewed distributions
C. sensitive to extreme values and highly skewed distributions
D. the most frequently occurring number
Answer: D

In terms of Hofstede’s (1980) five cultural dimensions, the United States scores at the top of the scale on:
A. individualism.
B. individualism and power distance.
C. power distance and masculinity.
D. uncertainty avoidance.
Answer: A

Carl Jung believed that a client's transference:
A. is a fantasy that distracts the client from reality.
B. represents “mixed feelings” toward the therapist. 
C. "is a form of ""acting out."""
D. reflects the client’s personal and collective unconscious.
Answer: D

In the construction of a multiple regression equation for purposes of prediction, the optimal combination of measures is one in which the predictors
A. are uncorrelated with each other but are moderately correlated with the criterion
B. have low correlations with each other and low correlations with the criterion
C. are highly intercorrelated with each other and moderately correlated with the criterion
D. have low correlations with the criterion bur are moderately correlated with each other
Answer: A

A. Emotional reactivity is often increased
B. Punishment merely suppresses unwanted behavior
C. The frequency of behavior is often low
D. Inhibition co conditioning is encountered
Answer: D

choice0: The receptive definitely allows a person to realize its true nature, to loving, creative, productive
choice1: The hoarding allows a person to realize its true nature, to be loving, creative, productive
choice2: The marketing surely allows a person to realize its true nature, to be loving, creative, productive
choice3: The productive allows a person to realize its true nature, to be loving, creative, etc.
completion:
The following are multiple choice questions (with answers) about  professional psychology.

One of your therapy clients asks your advice about a good weight- reduction program. You have investigated the programs in the community and are enrolled in the one you consider the best. This program offers a $50 bonus to its patrons for each new person they bring into the program. Under these circumstances, your most appropriate response would be to
A. tell your client the pros and cons of each program you know about except for the one in which you are enrolled
B. recommend to your client the program in which you are enrolled and explain the $50 bonus you will receive
C. recommend to your client the program in which you are enrolled and offer to have the $50 bonus credited to your client's account in the program
D. tell your client the pros and cons of each program you know about, but do not claim the $50 bonus if your client enrolls in your program
Answer: D

There are three ways to measure the Central Tendency: the Mean, the Median and the Mode. From your knowledge about them, what is the mode?
A. less sensitive to extreme scores than the mean
B. more useful for skewed distributions
C. sensitive to extreme values and highly skewed distributions
D. the most frequently occurring number
Answer: D

In terms of Hofstede’s (1980) five cultural dimensions, the United States scores at the top of the scale on:
A. individualism.
B. individualism and power distance.
C. power distance and masculinity.
D. uncertainty avoidance.
Answer: A

A. is a fantasy that distracts the client from reality.
B. represents “mixed feelings” toward the therapist. 
C. "is a form of ""acting out."""
D. reflects the client’s personal and collective unconscious.
Answer: D

D. have low correlations with the criterion bur are moderately correlated with each other
Answer: A
